title: Retail Food Group upsizes capital raising to $190m
text:
Fund manager Invesco, which is RFG's largest shareholder and currently holds a 14.5 per cent stake, has agreed to subscribe for enough new shares to lift its stake to 19.9 per cent.

The proceeds of the upsized capital raising will be used to pay down $118.5 million of RFG's $260 million of debt, which was due for refinancing this month, and provide working capital.

RFG's banks have also agreed to write down $72 million of debt as part of a new $75.5 million loan maturing in November 2022. Net debt will fall to about $54.6 million.

Executive chairman Peter George, who was appointed late last year to help turn the struggling company around, hailed the upsized raising and thanked investors for their support.

“We are delighted with the support received for the placement, and welcome a number of highly credentialled and supportive institutional investors to the shareholder register," Mr George said.

"The recapitalisation is transformational for the RFG business and will allow the RFG team to continue to harness the underlying value of the franchise network and enhance franchisee profitability.”

RFG expects underlying earnings before interest and tax, depreciation and amortisation to fall by at least 9.3 per cent and by as much as 17 per cent to between $42 million and $46 million this year.

The group lost $150 million in 2019 after booking another $185.3 million in ­impairments and provisions. This followed losses of $306.7 million in 2018.

RFG plans to close more than 120 stores by mid- 2020, after closing 330 stores in 2019, taking its network to about 827 outlets.
description: The owner of Michel's Patisserie and Donut King now plans to raise $190 million, up from $160 million last week, after strong support from investors.
